text: The song [strongs id="h7892" /] of songs [strongs id="h7892" /], which [is] Solomon’s [strongs id="h8010" /].

Let him kiss [strongs id="h5401" tvm="8799" /] me with the kisses [strongs id="h5390" /] of his mouth [strongs id="h6310" /]: for thy love [strongs id="h1730" /] [is] better [strongs id="h2896" /] than wine [strongs id="h3196" /].

Because of the savour [strongs id="h7381" /] of thy good [strongs id="h2896" /] ointments [strongs id="h8081" /] thy name [strongs id="h8034" /] [is as] ointment [strongs id="h8081" /] poured forth [strongs id="h7324" tvm="8714" /], therefore do the virgins [strongs id="h5959" /] love [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /] thee.

Draw [strongs id="h4900" tvm="8798" /] me, we will run [strongs id="h7323" tvm="8799" /] after [strongs id="h310" /] thee: the king [strongs id="h4428" /] hath brought [strongs id="h935" tvm="8689" /] me into his chambers [strongs id="h2315" /]: we will be glad [strongs id="h1523" tvm="8799" /] and rejoice [strongs id="h8055" tvm="8799" /] in thee, we will remember [strongs id="h2142" tvm="8686" /] thy love [strongs id="h1730" /] more than wine [strongs id="h3196" /]: the upright [strongs id="h4339" /] love [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /] thee.

I [am] black [strongs id="h7838" /], but comely [strongs id="h5000" /], O ye daughters [strongs id="h1323" /] of Jerusalem [strongs id="h3389" /], as the tents [strongs id="h168" /] of Kedar [strongs id="h6938" /], as the curtains [strongs id="h3407" /] of Solomon [strongs id="h8010" /].

Look [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8799" /] not upon me, because I [am] black [strongs id="h7840" /], because the sun [strongs id="h8121" /] hath looked [strongs id="h7805" tvm="8804" /] upon me: my mother’s [strongs id="h517" /] children [strongs id="h1121" /] were angry [strongs id="h2787" tvm="8738" /] with me; they made [strongs id="h7760" tvm="8804" /] me the keeper [strongs id="h5201" tvm="8802" /] of the vineyards [strongs id="h3754" /]; [but] mine own vineyard [strongs id="h3754" /] have I not kept [strongs id="h5201" tvm="8804" /].

Tell [strongs id="h5046" tvm="8685" /] me, O thou whom my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] loveth [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /], where thou feedest [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8799" /], where [strongs id="h349" /] thou makest [thy flock] to rest [strongs id="h7257" tvm="8686" /] at noon [strongs id="h6672" /]: for [strongs id="h4100" /] why should I be as one that turneth aside [strongs id="h5844" tvm="8802" /] by the flocks [strongs id="h5739" /] of thy companions [strongs id="h2270" /]?

If thou know [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8799" /] not, O thou fairest [strongs id="h3303" /] among women [strongs id="h802" /], go thy way forth [strongs id="h3318" tvm="8798" /] by the footsteps [strongs id="h6119" /] of the flock [strongs id="h6629" /], and feed [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8798" /] thy kids [strongs id="h1429" /] beside the shepherds [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8802" /]’ tents [strongs id="h4908" /].

I have compared [strongs id="h1819" tvm="8765" /] thee, O my love [strongs id="h7474" /], to a company of horses [strongs id="h5484" /] in Pharaoh’s [strongs id="h6547" /] chariots [strongs id="h7393" /].

Thy cheeks [strongs id="h3895" /] are comely [strongs id="h4998" tvm="8773" /] with rows [strongs id="h8447" /] [of jewels], thy neck [strongs id="h6677" /] with chains [strongs id="h2737" /] [of gold].
We will make [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /] thee borders [strongs id="h8447" /] of gold [strongs id="h2091" /] with studs [strongs id="h5351" /] of silver [strongs id="h3701" /].

While the king [strongs id="h4428" /] [sitteth] at his table [strongs id="h4524" /], my spikenard [strongs id="h5373" /] sendeth forth [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8804" /] the smell [strongs id="h7381" /] thereof.

A bundle [strongs id="h6872" /] of myrrh [strongs id="h4753" /] [is] my wellbeloved [strongs id="h1730" /] unto me; he shall lie [strongs id="h3885" tvm="8799" /] all night betwixt my breasts [strongs id="h7699" /].
My beloved [strongs id="h1730" /] [is] unto me [as] a cluster [strongs id="h811" /] of camphire [strongs id="h3724" /] in the vineyards [strongs id="h3754" /] of Engedi [strongs id="h5872" /].
Behold, thou [art] fair [strongs id="h3303" /], my love [strongs id="h7474" /]; behold, thou [art] fair [strongs id="h3303" /]; thou [hast] doves [strongs id="h3123" /]’ eyes [strongs id="h5869" /].
Behold, thou [art] fair [strongs id="h3303" /], my beloved [strongs id="h1730" /], yea, pleasant [strongs id="h5273" /]: also our bed [strongs id="h6210" /] [is] green [strongs id="h7488" /].

The beams [strongs id="h6982" /] of our house [strongs id="h1004" /] [are] cedar [strongs id="h730" /], [and] our rafters [strongs id="h7351" tvm="8675" /] [strongs id="h7351" /] of fir [strongs id="h1266" /].
I [am] the rose [strongs id="h2261" /] of Sharon [strongs id="h8289" /], [and] the lily [strongs id="h7799" /] of the valleys [strongs id="h6010" /].
As the lily [strongs id="h7799" /] among thorns [strongs id="h2336" /], so [is] my love [strongs id="h7474" /] among the daughters [strongs id="h1323" /].

As the apple tree [strongs id="h8598" /] among the trees [strongs id="h6086" /] of the wood [strongs id="h3293" /], so [is] my beloved [strongs id="h1730" /] among the sons [strongs id="h1121" /]. I sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8804" /] down under his shadow [strongs id="h6738" /] with great delight [strongs id="h2530" tvm="8765" /], and his fruit [strongs id="h6529" /] [was] sweet [strongs id="h4966" /] to my taste [strongs id="h2441" /].
He brought [strongs id="h935" tvm="8689" /] me to the banqueting [strongs id="h3196" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /], and his banner [strongs id="h1714" /] over me [was] love [strongs id="h160" /].

Stay [strongs id="h5564" tvm="8761" /] me with flagons [strongs id="h809" /], comfort [strongs id="h7502" tvm="8761" /] me with apples [strongs id="h8598" /]: for I [am] sick [strongs id="h2470" tvm="8802" /] of love [strongs id="h160" /].
His left hand [strongs id="h8040" /] [is] under my head [strongs id="h7218" /], and his right hand [strongs id="h3225" /] doth embrace [strongs id="h2263" tvm="8762" /] me.

I charge [strongs id="h7650" tvm="8689" /] you, O ye daughters [strongs id="h1323" /] of Jerusalem [strongs id="h3389" /], by the roes [strongs id="h6643" /], and [strongs id="h176" /] by the hinds [strongs id="h355" /] of the field [strongs id="h7704" /], that ye stir not up [strongs id="h5782" tvm="8686" /], nor awake [strongs id="h5782" tvm="8787" /] [my] love [strongs id="h160" /], till he please [strongs id="h2654" tvm="8799" /].

The voice [strongs id="h6963" /] of my beloved [strongs id="h1730" /]! behold, he cometh [strongs id="h935" tvm="8802" /] leaping [strongs id="h1801" tvm="8764" /] upon the mountains [strongs id="h2022" /], skipping [strongs id="h7092" tvm="8764" /] upon the hills [strongs id="h1389" /].

My beloved [strongs id="h1730" /] is like [strongs id="h1819" tvm="8802" /] a roe [strongs id="h6643" /] or a young [strongs id="h6082" /] hart [strongs id="h354" /]: behold, he standeth [strongs id="h5975" tvm="8802" /] behind [strongs id="h310" /] our wall [strongs id="h3796" /], he looketh forth [strongs id="h7688" tvm="8688" /] at the windows [strongs id="h2474" /], shewing [strongs id="h6692" tvm="8688" /] himself through the lattice [strongs id="h2762" /].

My beloved [strongs id="h1730" /] spake [strongs id="h6030" tvm="8804" /], and said [strongs id="h559" tvm="8804" /] unto me, Rise up [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8798" /], my love [strongs id="h7474" /], my fair one [strongs id="h3303" /], and come away [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8798" /].

For, lo, the winter [strongs id="h5638" /] is past [strongs id="h5674" tvm="8804" /], the rain [strongs id="h1653" /] is over [strongs id="h2498" tvm="8804" /] [and] gone [strongs id="h1980" tvm="8804" /];

The flowers [strongs id="h5339" /] appear [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8738" /] on the earth [strongs id="h776" /]; the time [strongs id="h6256" /] of the singing [strongs id="h2158" /] [of birds] is come [strongs id="h5060" tvm="8689" /], and the voice [strongs id="h6963" /] of the turtle [strongs id="h8449" /] is heard [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8738" /] in our land [strongs id="h776" /];

The fig tree [strongs id="h8384" /] putteth forth [strongs id="h2590" tvm="8804" /] her green figs [strongs id="h6291" /], and the vines [strongs id="h1612" /] [with] the tender grape [strongs id="h5563" /] give [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8804" /] a [good] smell [strongs id="h7381" /]. Arise [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8798" /], my love [strongs id="h7474" /], my fair one [strongs id="h3303" /], and come away [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8798" /].

O my dove [strongs id="h3123" /], [that art] in the clefts [strongs id="h2288" /] of the rock [strongs id="h5553" /], in the secret [strongs id="h5643" /] [places] of the stairs [strongs id="h4095" /], let me see [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8685" /] thy countenance [strongs id="h4758" /], let me hear [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8685" /] thy voice [strongs id="h6963" /]; for sweet [strongs id="h6156" /] [is] thy voice [strongs id="h6963" /], and thy countenance [strongs id="h4758" /] [is] comely [strongs id="h5000" /].

Take [strongs id="h270" tvm="8798" /] us the foxes [strongs id="h7776" /], the little [strongs id="h6996" /] foxes [strongs id="h7776" /], that spoil [strongs id="h2254" tvm="8764" /] the vines [strongs id="h3754" /]: for our vines [strongs id="h3754" /] [have] tender grapes [strongs id="h5563" /].
My beloved [strongs id="h1730" /] [is] mine, and I [am] his: he feedeth [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8802" /] among the lilies [strongs id="h7799" /].

Until the day [strongs id="h3117" /] break [strongs id="h6315" tvm="8799" /], and the shadows [strongs id="h6752" /] flee away [strongs id="h5127" tvm="8804" /], turn [strongs id="h5437" tvm="8798" /], my beloved [strongs id="h1730" /], and be thou like [strongs id="h1819" tvm="8798" /] a roe [strongs id="h6643" /] or a young [strongs id="h6082" /] hart [strongs id="h354" /] upon the mountains [strongs id="h2022" /] of Bether [strongs id="h1336" /].

By night [strongs id="h3915" /] on my bed [strongs id="h4904" /] I sought [strongs id="h1245" tvm="8765" /] him whom my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] loveth [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /]: I sought [strongs id="h1245" tvm="8765" /] him, but I found [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8804" /] him not.

I will rise [strongs id="h6965" tvm="8799" /] now, and go about [strongs id="h5437" tvm="8779" /] the city [strongs id="h5892" /] in the streets [strongs id="h7784" /], and in the broad ways [strongs id="h7339" /] I will seek [strongs id="h1245" tvm="8762" /] him whom my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] loveth [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /]: I sought [strongs id="h1245" tvm="8765" /] him, but I found [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8804" /] him not.

The watchmen [strongs id="h8104" tvm="8802" /] that go about [strongs id="h5437" tvm="8802" /] the city [strongs id="h5892" /] found [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8804" /] me: [to whom I said], Saw [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8804" /] ye him whom my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] loveth [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /]?

[It was] but a little [strongs id="h4592" /] that I passed [strongs id="h5674" tvm="8804" /] from them, but I found [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8804" /] him whom my soul [strongs id="h5315" /] loveth [strongs id="h157" tvm="8804" /]: I held [strongs id="h270" tvm="8804" /] him, and would not let him go [strongs id="h7503" tvm="8686" /], until I had brought [strongs id="h935" tvm="8689" /] him into my mother’s [strongs id="h517" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /], and into the chamber [strongs id="h2315" /] of her that conceived [strongs id="h2029" tvm="8802" /] me.

I charge [strongs id="h7650" tvm="8689" /] you, O ye daughters [strongs id="h1323" /] of Jerusalem [strongs id="h3389" /], by the roes [strongs id="h6643" /], and [strongs id="h176" /] by the hinds [strongs id="h355" /] of the field [strongs id="h7704" /], that ye stir not up [strongs id="h5782" tvm="8686" /], nor awake [strongs id="h5782" tvm="8787" /] [my] love [strongs id="h160" /], till he please [strongs id="h2654" tvm="8799" /].

Who [is] this that cometh [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8802" /] out of the wilderness [strongs id="h4057" /] like pillars [strongs id="h8490" /] of smoke [strongs id="h6227" /], perfumed [strongs id="h6999" tvm="8794" /] with myrrh [strongs id="h4753" /] and frankincense [strongs id="h3828" /], with all powders [strongs id="h81" /] of the merchant [strongs id="h7402" tvm="8802" /]?

Behold his bed [strongs id="h4296" /], which [is] Solomon’s [strongs id="h8010" /]; threescore [strongs id="h8346" /] valiant [strongs id="h1368" /] men [are] about [strongs id="h5439" /] it, of the valiant [strongs id="h1368" /] of Israel [strongs id="h3478" /].

They all hold [strongs id="h270" tvm="8803" /] swords [strongs id="h2719" /], [being] expert [strongs id="h3925" tvm="8794" /] in war [strongs id="h4421" /]: every man [strongs id="h376" /] [hath] his sword [strongs id="h2719" /] upon his thigh [strongs id="h3409" /] because of fear [strongs id="h6343" /] in the night [strongs id="h3915" /].

King [strongs id="h4428" /] Solomon [strongs id="h8010" /] made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] himself a chariot [strongs id="h668" /] of the wood [strongs id="h6086" /] of Lebanon [strongs id="h3844" /].

He made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] the pillars [strongs id="h5982" /] thereof [of] silver [strongs id="h3701" /], the bottom [strongs id="h7507" /] thereof [of] gold [strongs id="h2091" /], the covering [strongs id="h4817" /] of it [of] purple [strongs id="h713" /], the midst [strongs id="h8432" /] thereof being paved [strongs id="h7528" tvm="8803" /] [with] love [strongs id="h160" /], for the daughters [strongs id="h1323" /] of Jerusalem [strongs id="h3389" /].

Go forth [strongs id="h3318" tvm="8798" /], O ye daughters [strongs id="h1323" /] of Zion [strongs id="h6726" /], and behold [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8798" /] king [strongs id="h4428" /] Solomon [strongs id="h8010" /] with the crown [strongs id="h5850" /] wherewith his mother [strongs id="h517" /] crowned [strongs id="h5849" tvm="8765" /] him in the day [strongs id="h3117" /] of his espousals [strongs id="h2861" /], and in the day [strongs id="h3117" /] of the gladness [strongs id="h8057" /] of his heart [strongs id="h3820" /].

Behold, thou [art] fair [strongs id="h3303" /], my love [strongs id="h7474" /]; behold, thou [art] fair [strongs id="h3303" /]; thou [hast] doves [strongs id="h3123" /]’ eyes [strongs id="h5869" /] within [strongs id="h1157" /] thy locks [strongs id="h6777" /]: thy hair [strongs id="h8181" /] [is] as a flock [strongs id="h5739" /] of goats [strongs id="h5795" /], that appear [strongs id="h1570" /] from mount [strongs id="h2022" /] Gilead [strongs id="h1568" /].

Thy teeth [strongs id="h8127" /] [are] like a flock [strongs id="h5739" /] [of sheep that are even] shorn [strongs id="h7094" tvm="8803" /], which came up [strongs id="h5927" tvm="8804" /] from the washing [strongs id="h7367" /]; whereof every one bear twins [strongs id="h8382" tvm="8688" /], and none [is] barren [strongs id="h7909" /] among them.

Thy lips [strongs id="h8193" /] [are] like a thread [strongs id="h2339" /] of scarlet [strongs id="h8144" /], and thy speech [strongs id="h4057" /] [is] comely [strongs id="h5000" /]: thy temples [strongs id="h7541" /] [are] like a piece [strongs id="h6400" /] of a pomegranate [strongs id="h7416" /] within [strongs id="h1157" /] thy locks [strongs id="h6777" /].

Thy neck [strongs id="h6677" /] [is] like the tower [strongs id="h4026" /] of David [strongs id="h1732" /] builded [strongs id="h1129" tvm="8803" /] for an armoury [strongs id="h8530" /], whereon there hang [strongs id="h8518" tvm="8803" /] a thousand [strongs id="h505" /] bucklers [strongs id="h4043" /], all shields [strongs id="h7982" /] of mighty men [strongs id="h1368" /].

Thy two [strongs id="h8147" /] breasts [strongs id="h7699" /] [are] like two [strongs id="h8147" /] young [strongs id="h6082" /] roes [strongs id="h6646" /] that are twins [strongs id="h8380" /], which feed [strongs id="h7462" tvm="8802" /] among the lilies [strongs id="h7799" /].

Until the day [strongs id="h3117" /] break [strongs id="h6315" tvm="8799" /], and the shadows [strongs id="h6752" /] flee away [strongs id="h5127" tvm="8804" /], I will get [strongs id="h3212" tvm="8799" /] me to the mountain [strongs id="h2022" /] of myrrh [strongs id="h4753" /], and to the hill [strongs id="h1389" /] of frankincense [strongs id="h3828" /].
Thou [art] all fair [strongs id="h3303" /], my love [strongs id="h7474" /]; [there is] no spot [strongs id="h3971" /] in thee.

Come [strongs id="h935" tvm="8799" /] with me from Lebanon [strongs id="h3844" /], [my] spouse [strongs id="h3618" /], with me from Lebanon [strongs id="h3844" /]: look [strongs id="h7789" tvm="8799" /] from the top [strongs id="h7218" /] of Amana [strongs id="h549" /], from the top [strongs id="h7218" /] of Shenir [strongs id="h8149" /] and Hermon [strongs id="h2768" /], from the lions [strongs id="h738" /]’ dens [strongs id="h4585" /], from the mountains [strongs id="h2042" /] of the leopards [strongs id="h5246" /].

Thou hast ravished my heart [strongs id="h3823" tvm="8765" /], my sister [strongs id="h269" /], [my] spouse [strongs id="h3618" /]; thou hast ravished my heart [strongs id="h3823" tvm="8765" /] with one [strongs id="h259" /] of thine eyes [strongs id="h5869" /], with one [strongs id="h259" /] chain [strongs id="h6060" /] of thy neck [strongs id="h6677" /].

How fair [strongs id="h3302" tvm="8804" /] is thy love [strongs id="h1730" /], my sister [strongs id="h269" /], [my] spouse [strongs id="h3618" /]! how much better [strongs id="h2895" tvm="8804" /] is thy love [strongs id="h1730" /] than wine [strongs id="h3196" /]! and the smell [strongs id="h7381" /] of thine ointments [strongs id="h8081" /] than all spices [strongs id="h1314" /]!

Thy lips [strongs id="h8193" /], O [my] spouse [strongs id="h3618" /], drop [strongs id="h5197" tvm="8799" /] [as] the honeycomb [strongs id="h5317" /]: honey [strongs id="h1706" /] and milk [strongs id="h2461" /] [are] under thy tongue [strongs id="h3956" /]; and the smell [strongs id="h7381" /] of thy garments [strongs id="h8008" /] [is] like the smell [strongs id="h7381" /] of Lebanon [strongs id="h3844" /].

A garden [strongs id="h1588" /] inclosed [strongs id="h5274" tvm="8803" /] [is] my sister [strongs id="h269" /], [my] spouse [strongs id="h3618" /]; a spring [strongs id="h1530" /] shut up [strongs id="h5274" tvm="8803" /], a fountain [strongs id="h4599" /] sealed [strongs id="h2856" tvm="8803" /].

Thy plants [strongs id="h7973" /] [are] an orchard [strongs id="h6508" /] of pomegranates [strongs id="h7416" /], with pleasant [strongs id="h4022" /] fruits [strongs id="h6529" /]; camphire [strongs id="h3724" /], with spikenard [strongs id="h5373" /],

Spikenard [strongs id="h5373" /] and saffron [strongs id="h3750" /]; calamus [strongs id="h7070" /] and cinnamon [strongs id="h7076" /], with all trees [strongs id="h6086" /] of frankincense [strongs id="h3828" /]; myrrh [strongs id="h4753" /] and aloes [strongs id="h174" /], with all the chief [strongs id="h7218" /] spices [strongs id="h1314" /]:

A fountain [strongs id="h4599" /] of gardens [strongs id="h1588" /], a well [strongs id="h875" /] of living [strongs id="h2416" /] waters [strongs id="h4325" /], and streams [strongs id="h5140" tvm="8802" /] from Lebanon [strongs id="h3844" /].
